description: Lenart Kova decides to trigger a citywide blackout at the main metro junction, risking exposure to give citizens a clear, symbolic rallying point against the BCI system.

A sudden blackout hits key metro sectors. Part of the metro wall collapses, revealing a hidden mural depicting Marek Halden unraveling his shadow. Bystanders quickly gather and begin photographing the mural.

Images and videos of the uncovered mural spread rapidly citywide. The mural becomes a viral symbol, fueling debate about Halden’s intent and the true purpose of the BCI. Citizens use the site to voice defiance against algorithmic rule.

Crowds continue to gather at the mural. Residents use augmented reality projections and graffiti to demand an end to BCI governance. Directorate deploys patrols and attempts to block access, but faces growing resistance.

The Council fractures: Directorate calls for suppression and removal of all mural references, while Innovators push to examine Halden’s archived directives for answers. Harmonists are largely ignored as public unrest surges.
